author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Centre is trying to motivate Indian aviation players to operate more services to foreign destinations that would prove beneficial to them, Civil Aviation Minister P. Ashok Gajapathi Raju said on Friday. Making it clear that the Centre was not against foreign players operating services from India to other overseas destinations, the Minister said the government wanted Indian players to go truly global.

In a brief interaction with reporters after a meeting with the stakeholders at the Tiruchi International Airport, Mr. Raju said the Centre was keen that the advantage should go to the Indian aviation players.

Replying to a query on the delay in executing Tiruchi airport runway expansion plan, Mr. Raju said land acquisition was a State subject.
title: Centre keen on promoting Indian aviation players: Minister
